meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Meredith Larson Phil Lowe Craig Cornish, Jr. Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6727.

td.p: Meredith Larson, an attorney from Washington, D.C.
Phil Lowe, a process automation engineer from Raleigh, North Carolina
Craig Cornish, Jr., a graduate student of history from Welcome, Maryland (whose 2-day cash winnings total $46,800)

tr.td: YOU FLOOR ME!
SEND IN THE MARINES
"N" THE ATLAS
CONTROL
ALT
DELETE

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'An upper floor in a barn to store hay, or an upper floor in a warehouse converted into an apartment')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: An upper floor in a barn to store hay, or an upper floor in a warehouse converted into an apartment

Phil
Meredith
THERE'S NO PLACE LIKE DOME
GUARDS

tr.td: Craig
Phil
Meredith

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: If I look at it correctly, there were six panels there, and six is a number that we associate with one state in particular.)
...
(Alex: [To Meredith] You got the state right, but we were looking for the city--the capital city of [*].)
PhilWhat is Richmond, VA?
$1,600
CraigWhat is Tallahassee?
$11,400
MeredithWhat is Texas?
$2,000
Austin')

tr.td: STATE CAPITALS
It's the Southern city in which the building seen here is located; counting the panels may help
Craig
Phil
Meredith
3rd place: $1,000
2nd place: $2,000
New champion: $19,900
Craig
Phil
Meredith
